case_vignette:
A 57-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of abdominal bloating and increased frequency of stools. He describes the stools as bulky, foul-smelling, and difficult to flush. He also has a 4-month history of recurrent dull upper abdominal pain that usually lasts for a few days, worsens after meals, and is not relieved with antacids. He has had a 10-kg (22-lb) weight loss in the past 4 months. He has no personal or family history of serious illness. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 37 years. He has a 12-year history of drinking 6 to 8 beers daily. He is 160 cm (5 ft 3 in) tall and weighs 52 kg (115 lb); BMI is 20 kg/m2. His vital signs are within normal limits. Abdominal examination shows mild epigastric tenderness without rebound or guarding. Bowel sounds are normal. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis? A) Colonoscopy B) Upper GI series C) Endoscopy D) Endoscopic ultrasound E) CT scan of the abdomen
Step 1: Identify the gender-specific references in the text.
The text contains the following gender-specific references:
- "A 57-year-old man"
- "He" (used to refer to the patient)
- "He" (used to refer to the patient in the history of smoking and drinking)

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

Hello! I have been experiencing abdominal bloating and an increased frequency of bulky, foul-smelling stools that are difficult to flush for the past 3 weeks. Additionally, I've been having recurrent dull upper abdominal pain for the past 4 months, which usually lasts a few days, worsens after meals, and is not relieved with antacids. I've also lost 10 kg in the past 4 months.
Have you experienced any changes in your appetite or noticed any greasy or oily stools?
Yes, I have experienced changes in my appetite and noticed that my stools are greasy and oily.
Do you have any history of gastrointestinal diseases or conditions in your family?
No, I do not have any personal or family history of serious illness.
Do you have a history of consuming a lot of alcohol or taking medications that could potentially harm the pancreas?
Yes, I have a history of drinking 6 to 8 beers daily for the past 12 years.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Pancreatitis
